title: NASA approves demonstration flight for circular DiskSats
summary: NASA approved a demonstration flight for DiskSat, the thin round satellite designed by the Aerospace Corp.

title: Epsilon3 raises $15 million for space project management platform
summary: Software startup Epsilon3 said June 20 it has raised $15 million to expand its suite of space project management solutions.

title: House Armed Services bill proposes $75 million for rapid space launch activities
summary: House Armed Services Committee Chairman Rep. Adam Smith (D-Wash.) in the 2023 National Defense Authorization Act proposes adding $75 million to the Pentagon’s budget for “tactically responsive space."

title: NASA making fourth attempt to complete Artemis 1 Wet Dress Rehearsal
summary: NASA is counting down the fourth attempt at completing a practice launch day exercise with its Artemis 1 vehicle on the launch pad at the Kennedy Space Center (KSC) in Florida. The June 20 Wet Dress Rehearsal (WDR) test attempt is scheduled to culminate in two runs of the countdown’s final ten minutes with the integrated Orion spacecraft and Space Launch System (SLS) rocket for Artemis 1 fully fueled and pressurized like it will be for launch.

title: SpaceX to attempt to crush Starship test tank
summary: A week after rolling a different ‘test tank’ from its South Texas Starship factory to nearby launch and test facilities, SpaceX has...

title: We got a leaked look at NASA’s future Moon missions—and likely delays
summary: "Has nobody at NASA read the space policy?"

title: China aims to bring Mars samples to Earth 2 years before NASA, ESA mission
summary: China’s Mars sample return mission aims to collect samples from the Red Planet and deliver them to Earth in 2031, or two years ahead of a NASA and ESA joint mission.

title: Space Force to establish intelligence unit at Wright-Patterson Air Force Base
summary: The U.S. Space Force on June 24 plans to formally establish the National Space Intelligence Center at Wright-Patterson Air Force Base, Ohio.

title: SpaceX launches three Falcon 9 rockets in 36 hours
summary: SpaceX has successfully completed three Falcon 9 launches in just over 36 hours, highlighting the company’s continuous push towards ever-higher launch cadences...

title: Researchers use Hubble to observe dead star destroying planetary system
summary: A team of researchers using archival data from the Hubble Space Telescope, a joint venture between NASA and the European Space Agency (ESA), as well as other NASA observatories have observed a white dwarf consuming and destroying a planetary system — the first time an observation of such kind has been made.
